main event: Unidentified flying object (UFO) sightings near Los Alamos, New Mexico in December 1952 including round, luminous objects with trails of sparks, a bright white object with a slight reddish glow, and an elongated, cigar-shaped object witnessed by multiple individuals, including Atomic Energy Commission security employees.
interesting points: One sighting described an object resembling a tennis ball with a handkerchief around it.
Security investigator Grande Derry observed a round, white object traveling at an estimated speed of 600 - 800 mph and confirmed it was not a star, planet, or any known aircraft.
Different conclusions were reached for the sightings, including 'probably meteor' and 'probably a large jet aircraft'.
Some reports mentioned unusual high-pitched sounds accompanying the sightings.
The credibility of the witnesses was considered excellent in some of the reports.
result: The sightings resulted in differing conclusions, with some categorized as probably meteors or astronomical phenomena, and others linked to large jet exhaust or unexplained aerial objects (UFOs).
sighted object: Various unidentified flying objects including round, luminous objects, bright white objects with trails of sparks, and an elongated, cigar-shaped object.
witnesses: Multiple witnesses including Atomic Energy Commission security employees and a security investigator
photographs: No, the reports did not include photographs
